question: [File: aptos-core/execution/block-partitioner/src/pre_partition/mod.rs] [Concurrency] [Spawn Failure] Can thread_pool.spawn() fail to spawn threads when system resources are exhausted, causing silent failure in cleanup code? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/execution/block-partitioner/src/pre_partition/mod.rs] [Concurrency] [Work Stealing] If the thread pool uses work stealing, can this introduce non-determinism in execution order that affects partitioning results? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/execution/block-partitioner/src/pre_partition/mod.rs] [Metadata] [Group Metadata Consistency] Can mismatches between group_metadata entries and actual txns_by_set contents cause assertion failures or incorrect partition results? (High)

[File: aptos-core/execution/block-partitioner/src/pre_partition/mod.rs] [Metadata] [Set Index Overflow] Can set_idx_counter overflow when processing blocks with many unique transaction sets, causing index wraparound and collisions? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/execution/block-partitioner/src/pre_partition/mod.rs] [Metadata] [Registry Cleanup] Are intermediate data structures like set_idx_registry properly cleaned up, or can they cause memory leaks over multiple blocks? (Low)
